header.safetyMessage: Don't hand your data to US authorities.

hero.subtitle: No more data sent to the US
hero.cta: Full migration with zero downtime, guaranteed data sovereignty.

need.title: Why migrate away from US hyperscalers now?
need.description: The US CLOUD Act grants American authorities access to data stored by US companies — even on EU servers. Schrems II invalidated the Privacy Shield. Your compliance is at risk. OpenTelekomCloud keeps your data in German data centers, operated exclusively under EU law by Deutsche Telekom / T-Systems.

usCloud.title: US CLOUD Act Risk
usCloud.description: US cloud providers are subject to the US CLOUD Act. US authorities may access your data at any time even if it's stored on EU servers.

euCloud.title: EU Data Sovereignty
euCloud.description: Play it safe: migrate today to a 100% European, GDPR-compliant cloud. Operated by a german company and hosted on a EU cloud.

experience.title: Proven Expertise
experience.description: We’ve led 100+ successful migrations to OpenTelekomCloud, from startups to platforms with millions of daily users.

cloudSecOps.title: CloudSecOps as a Service
cloudSecOps.description: Not only the migration is included but you get a full CloudSecOps Team which will maintain and operate the cloud for you

compliance.title: Certified out of the box
compliance.description: With us operations, service and infrastructure is already certified*. We can get you certified in no time

migration.title: Seamless Migration
migration.description: Zero-downtime migration with rollback capabilities and comprehensive testing.

security.title: Enhanced Security
security.description: European CloudSecOps team and data centers with no US jurisdiction. Your data stays in the EU.

cost.title: Free Migration Plan
cost.description: Let our team analyze your current US cloud setup and we create a free migration roadmap for you.

contact.title: Talk to an Expert
contact.name: Victor Getz
contact.cta: Let's discuss your migration to OpenTelekomCloud

disclaimer: *Currently in process, will be most probably finished in 2026
